column4: only thing I don't like about linux is that everything seems biggers, like the text, and stuff
lol how can i change it similar to windows?
not sure
I think gnome
i see hold on
wait.
do NOT install kubuntu-desktop until you give it a LOT of thought
because you will be installing an entirely different desktop manager, its associated libs, and its associated apps.
not without effort
you can customize GNOME to look XP-ish, or switch to KDE. but the switch is not trivial, and you should give it some thought before you do.
but I want it to look similar to xp?
System -> Administration -> Device Manager
you can move the top and bottom panels, change fonts, change desktops, etc etc.
you should not have to compile stuff very often. there are packages for almost everything.
can you hear the login sound?
Nope
: What should I do to get this working?
checked the BIOS settings?
bios setting were fine, I just took windows out it always worked before?
so yea the bios are fine
It worked in Windows means nothing in Linux.
no, not necessarily.
e.g. "Enable Plug And Play OS" in a BIOS worked fine with Windows. brought BeOS to its knees. what works for one OS in a BIOS may well not work for another.
okay im going to restart, and what should I check the bios for?
